description: A classical dance form with precise movements and formal gestures.
A dance style where you make rhythmic sounds with your shoes.
A lively dance style that involves kicks and turns to the beat of the music.
A street dance style performed to hip-hop music with a free, energetic vibe.
A Latin dance with quick steps and turns, often danced with a partner.
A passionate dance from Argentina with close contact between partners.
Traditional dances that are often centuries old and tied to a culture.
A fluid dance style that combines elements of several dance genres.
A Spanish dance with forceful footwork, clapping, and vibrant costumes.
An ancient Indian dance known for its fixed upper torso, bent legs, and intricate gestures.
An athletic style of street dance with spins and acrobatic moves.
Elegant partner dances with structured steps, like the waltz and foxtrot.
A group of dances that developed with swing jazz music in the 1920s-1940s.
A high-energy dance with expressive, exaggerated, and fast movements.
A joyful dance that includes flips and throws, often to big band music.
A dance that involves quickly contracting and relaxing muscles to create a jerking effect.
A funk dance with distinct pauses and fast arm and hand movements.
A fluid dance style that involves rolling the hips, knees, and head.
A dance to disco music that involves moving the arms to the beat.
A stylized dance originating from the Harlem ballroom scene in the 1960s.
A type of folk dance where you wear shoes with taps to produce a distinctive sound.
